titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joseph W. Gordon, Deputy Dean of Yale College, Records
Gordon (Joseph W.), Deputy Dean of Yale College, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Michael Lotstein

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 10:54

did.unittitle: Joseph W. Gordon, Deputy Dean of Yale College, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection contains the records of Joseph W. Gordon, Deputy Dean of Yale College and Dean of Undergraduate Edcuation. Includes administrative files which consist of reports, meeting notes and materials, and reports with supporting materials.

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 9-B (YRG 9-B), Records of deputy, associate, and assistant deans of Yale College.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Joseph W. Gordon, Deputy Dean of Yale College (RU 1141). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains the records of Joseph W. Gordon, Deputy Dean of Yale College and Dean of Undergraduate Edcuation. Includes administrative files which consist of reports, meeting notes and materials, and reports with supporting materials.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by accession.
